a.span: The WJHSD and all K-12 schools in the state of PA will be closed beginning Monday, March 16 throughout the remainder of the year with online instruction beginning on Monday, March 30, 2020.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

br.span:
Online registration for students entering Kindergarten at the beginning of the 2020-2021 school year is now open! If you have an existing Skyward account, please log in to your parent/guardian account and click "New Student Registration" located on the upper left-hand side of your screen. If you do not have an existing Skyward account, please use this link to complete the process: https://skyward.iscorp.com/scripts/wsisa.dll/WService=wseduwjeffersonpa/skyenroll.w
If you experience any difficulties in completing the online registration process, please contact Mrs. Laurie Woodward, Student Enrollment Specialist at [email protected] or by phone - 412-655-8450 ext. 2247. Thank you for your continued support of the West Jefferson Hills School District.
Please click here to read the letter from Matthew Patterson, Assistant Superintendent of Elementary Education, on the district's enrollment numbers and attendance boundaries.
The District offers several insurance options for parents wishing to purchase Chromebook and/or iPad insurance for students. Click here to be directed to the online technology insurance portal.

West Jefferson Hills School District recognizes that student wellness and proper nutrition are related to students' physical well-being, growth, development and readiness to learn and has adopted a District Wellness Policy to support our students. Click here to view the Wellness Policy.

West Jefferson Hills School District will be using the School Messenger system to deliver text messages, straight to your mobile phone with important information about events, school closings, safety alerts and more. You will be given the opportunity to choose whether or not you would like to receive these text messages. Click here to view the flyer with additional information from School Messenger on receiving text messages.

div.span: West Jefferson Hills School District Recognized as Common Sense District

p.img: Common Sense Education, the national nonprofit organization dedicated to helping kids and families thrive in a world of digital media and technology, has recognized the West Jefferson Hills School District as a Common Sense District. As part of our commitment to personalized learning and 1:1 technology, the district has implemented Digital Citizenship classes for all students in grades 5- 12. We have partnered with Common Sense Media to provide our students with the necessary skills and information to conduct themselves in a safe and responsible manner online.
